headline: Trump threatens tariffs over Greenland, addresses AI power costs
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including President Trump's latest comments about placing tariffs on countries that disagree with the proposed US annexation of Greenland and how shares of energy companies Vistra (VST), Constellation Energy (CEG), and GE Vernova (GEV) are reacting to the administration's proposals to help lower power casts as Big Tech plan AI data center projects. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

summary: Shares in memory-chip maker Micron rally after board member Mark Liu snaps up $7.8 million worth of stock.

headline: Trump To Propose Tech Giants Fund Power Grid Buildouts, Energy Stocks Swing
summary: The Trump administration has a new proposal to combat soaring power costs from data center, artificial intelligence demand.

headline: Trump Has a New Plan to Power AI; GE Vernova and Others Should Benefit
summary: Trump and several governors are pushing a plan to spur new power plants for AI data centers. Equipment makers jumped, while owners of existing plants fell.

raw.headline: Trump Has a New Plan to Power AI; GE Vernova and Others Should Benefit

headline: GE Vernova shares rise as Trump, governors push for PJM power auction
summary: Investing.com -- GE Vernova shares rose 3.7% in pre-market trading Friday after reports that President Trump and governors from PJM Interconnection states will announce plans for an emergency wholesale electricity auction aimed at addressing power reliability and affordability concerns.

raw.headline: GE Vernova shares rise as Trump, governors push for PJM power auction

headline: 2 S&P 500 Stocks with Promising Prospects and 1 We Turn Down
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is home to the biggest and most well-known companies in the market, making it a go-to index for investors seeking stability. But not all large-cap stocks are created equal - some are struggling with slowing growth, declining margins, or increased competition.
